results.title: Night train [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tristan Orpen Lynch, Subotica Films, Coachouse Productions and John Lynch
results.brief_description: Night train is a romantic drama by first time director John Lynch featuring Oscar nominees John Hurt (Elephant Man, 1984) as Michael Poole, an ex-con man, and Brenda Blethyn (Secrets and Lies, Saving Grace) as Alice, the landlady’s daughter. Upon release from prison, Michael Poole seeks refuge in an effort to avoid pursuit by a sinister gangland boss to whom he owes money. He moves into a house owned by an elderly domineering mother (Pauline Flanagan) and her emotionally repressed daughter, Alice. Poole finds his passion for electric model trains has Alice intrigued and together they find escape in his strange fantasy world. An awkward and tender romance begins to develop between these two rather sad and lonely people, frustrated by their pasts, and determined to find happiness in their future. But Poole is forced to take flight as the mob boss closes in, and with him Alice, on a real night train adventure on the Orient Express. Set in Dublin and filmed on location in Ireland, England and Italy, “Night train” has many delightful and touching moments performed by two great actors and a very capable supporting cast. Cast also includes Lorcan Cranitch, Cathy White, Peter Caffrey, Paul Roe and Rynagh O’Grady. (Awards: Winner Silver Rose Best Actor John Hurt, Schermi d’Amore Verona; Nominated Best European Film John Lynch, Brussels International Film Festival)

results.title: Night people's day
results.brief_description: Explores the city at night with emphasis on people who work at night and their occupations. The soundtrack recreates, with human voices and sound effects, the variety of sounds of the city and its activities. Night people tell why they prefer to work at night. Photography by Bob Hillman. Vocal sound effects by Bob Kurtz and Glenn Johnson.

results.title: Night on Bald Mountain = Nuit sur le Mont Chauve
results.brief_description: A significant early animation from the silent/sound transition period, this fantasy is based on Mussorgsky’s tone (symphonic) poem, evoking a world of demons, witches and goblins. The first film by the Parisian lithographer, Alexander Alexeieff (made with the assistance of his wife Claire Parker) using his famous pinboard invention which allowed production of a great range of tonal qualities.

results.title: Night flight
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Malcolm Patterson

results.title: Night driving
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, John Edwards and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
If your vision is normal and the lighting equipment of your car is in efficient working order, there is nothing to be scared of in night driving. The same section of road from a driver’s viewpoint is shown by day and by night, pointing out the different methods of detecting various features which will affect course and speed in night driving.

results.title: Nigeria 1960 - sunrise in the east
results.creator_credit: Andre Libik, Victor M. Gover, British Information Services and Eric Chamberlain

results.title: Nigeria's University College
results.creator_credit: Nigerian Film Unit and Lionel Snazelle
results.brief_description: This film follows the various stages in the building of the University College at Ibadan, in Nigeria, designed by Jane drew and Maxwell Fry, The British architects, who supervised the work on the spot.

results.title: Nicky: one of my best friends
results.creator_credit: Togg Films, McGraw-Hill Films, Grania Gurievitch and Anthony Jones
results.brief_description: Nicky is a blind boy who also suffers from cerebral palsy. This film shows him at home with his family and at school with his friends. Nicky attends a normal school because his parents feel that he would benefit more by being in the mainstream.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Togg Films, McGraw-Hill Films, Grania Gurievitch and Anthony Jones

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Armorer Wason, Granite Film, Granada International Productions and Michael Beckham
results.brief_description: For over 70 years the story of Russia’s last Tsar, Nicholas II and his Empress, Alexandra has exercised a poignant magic. Presented by His Royal Highness Prince Michael of Kent, this documentary delves into the imperial archives held in Moscow and St Petersberg, once sealed by the Secret Police and forbidden to all but a handful of curators. The archives reveal intimate diaries and letters of the Romanovs, their photograph albums, records of state visits and political intrigue.
